title: Garlic-lime Swordfish
summary: Garlic-lime Swordfish might be a good recipe to expand your main course repertoire. One portion of this dish contains about 136g of protein, 102g of fat, and a total of 1542 calories. This recipe serves 1 and costs $16.92 per serving. 1 person found this recipe to be flavorful and satisfying. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian diet. If you have sugar, lime juice, tomato paste, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the sugar you could follow this main course with the Whole Wheat Refined Sugar Free Sugar Cookies as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 3 hours and 12 minutes. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 71%, which is solid. Similar recipes are Garlic-Lime Swordfish, Ginger Lime Swordfish, and Ginger-Lime Swordfish.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 23 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Depending on the soil and microclimate, Pinot gris varies from a simple everyday wine all the way up to absolute top growths. The warm, sun-exposed vineyards of the Anger sites, with their loamy limestone gravel soils, are a textbook example. The Anger Alto Adige Pinot Grigio has a noble structure, nice balance and fine acidity – making it an absolute pleasure to drink. The strong white goes well with fish and fish soup, guinea fowl breast or veal fillet.

instructions: Combine juice, zest, oil, paste, garlic, salt, sugar, and pepper.Marinate fish for at least 3 hours.Broil for 5-7 minutes on each side.

steps.step: Combine juice, zest, oil, paste, garlic, salt, sugar, and pepper.Marinate fish for at least 3 hours.Broil for 5-7 minutes on each side.
